column1: 1.  This Court is called upon to determine whether the actions of the Respondents

column2: in  classifying  the  Petitioners—officers  previously  recruited  to  the  Reserve
Assistant Superintendent of Police cadre—into a "Support Service" within the
regular  police  structure  amounts  to  a  violation  of  their  fundamental  rights
guaranteed under Article 12(1) of the Constitution.

column1: 2.  This  application  SC  FR  36/2020  consolidates  the  grievances  arising  from  a

column2: series of prior proceedings, namely SC FR 374/07, SC FR 348/12, SC FR 71/16,
and SC Contempt 05/20. The parties have consented to the determination in
this case as dispositive of the other related matters.

column1: 3.  The Petitioners were recruited as Reserve Assistant Superintendents of Police

column2: on  21st  March  2006,  at  a  time  when  the  Police  Reserve  Service  had  been
abolished.  By  a  Cabinet  decision,  it  was  agreed  that  these  officers  would  be

column1: absorbed into the Regular Police Service.
